item.title: XSS attack
item.author: Hato0
item.description: Cross-site scripting Cross-site scripting is used to inject malicious javascript code to user browser. This attack can lead to a total control of the application in use. More details and specific stuff can be found here Basics Exploiting cross-site scripting to steal cookies This part represent the principal use of XSS. Web apps usually use cookies to save and remember sessions. In that way, this attack get the cookie in question and send it back to your own domain so you can easily capture it.
